Posts.EditableText: Is there a way to override the 'go to' command and change it to simply go? If not is it planned for the next version?
Posts.HTML: Is there a way to override the 'go to' command and change it to simply go? If not is it planned for the next version?

Posts.EditableText:
To allow a player to type in "go (room)" instead of "go to (room)" all you have to do is in the editor: click 'Text' at upper menu bar, click 'Synonyms...', click 'Add' button, click 'Add Synonym' button, type 'go' in text box, click 'OK' button, type 'go to' in lower text box (...to:), click 'OK' button, click 'OK' button, and save your change for it to take effect.  What you've done is created a synonym for the phrase 'go to.'  Now anytime a player enters 'go to' followed by text, Quest will interpret it as 'go' followed by text.

-Witch
Posts.HTML:
To allow a player to type in "go (room)" instead of "go to (room)" all you have to do is in the editor: click 'Text' at upper menu bar, click 'Synonyms...', click 'Add' button, click 'Add Synonym' button, type 'go' in text box, click 'OK' button, type 'go to' in lower text box (...to:), click 'OK' button, click 'OK' button, and save your change for it to take effect. What you've done is created a synonym for the phrase 'go to.' Now anytime a player enters 'go to' followed by text, Quest will interpret it as 'go' followed by text.

-Witch

Posts.EditableText:
Make a note, that whenever you "click" on a (place) in the right hand Quest-menu to move there now, Quest will not understand that direction anymore.  It will only understand "go (place)".

-W
Posts.HTML:
Make a note, that whenever you "click" on a (place) in the right hand Quest-menu to move there now, Quest will not understand that direction anymore. It will only understand "go (place)".

-W
